title: Cornbread Salad Recipe
description: This layered cornbread salad is so flavorsome and a real crowd-pleaser, thanks to the addition of corn, tomatoes, bacon, and a creamy herb dressing.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Layered Cornbread Salad 4.6 (187) 155 Reviews 11 Photos This crowd-pleasing cornbread salad is quite unique but tastes great! Submitted by Rosemarie Updated on November 26, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 11 11 11 11 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 50 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings Cornbread: cooking spray 1 (16 ounce) package corn bread mix 1 ½ cups water Salad: 10 slices bacon 1 ½ cups sour cream 1 ½ cups mayonnaise 1 (1 ounce) package ranch dressing mix 2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained 3 tomatoes, chopped 1 cup chopped green bell pepper 1 cup chopped green onion 2 (11 ounce) cans whole kernel corn, drained 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese Directions Make the cornbread: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray the bottom and sides of an 8x8-inch pan with cooking spray. Combine cornbread mix and water in a large mixing bowl until smooth; pour into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Let cool; crumble and set aside. Meanwhile, make the salad: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Whisk sour cream, mayonnaise, and dressing mix together in a medium bowl. Crumble 1/2 of the cornbread in the bottom of a large serving dish. Evenly layer with 1 can of pinto beans, 1/2 of the tomatoes, 1/2 cup green bell pepper, 1/2 cup green onions, 1 can of corn, 1 cup of cheese, 1/2 of the bacon, and 1/2 of the sour cream mixture. Repeat the layers. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours before serving. fabeveryday I Made It Print 294 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Cornbread Salad 01 of 11 Photo by  fabeveryday 02 of 11 Photo by  fabeveryday 11/16/2024 I’d never had cornbread salad before, so I didn’t know what to expect, but the flavors worked together so well! My Texan husband approved and the kids even loved it (I wasn’t sure what they’d think of all the ingredients in the combo). The ranch dressing part was key to the flavor to me, so I wouldn’t skip that in favor of bottled ranch. 03 of 11 Photo by  Stacey Lowden 04/18/2020 tried this in Waynesville, North Carolina and it was wonderful! This is a close second. 04 of 11 Photo by  Casablancaise 05/09/2016 The family was divided on this one.. My husband and I liked it but the kids didn't. These are kids that eat all kind of salads, on the regular basis. The only changes were omitting the bacon and using red bell pepper for tomatoes. Mainly 2 issues were here : I used leftover cornbread that was a tad sweet and that made the salad overall taste on the sweet side. Also the dressing and the rest of the ingredients didn't combine because of the layering and it made some bites too dry and some with too much dressing. If I make this again, I will use a different kind of cornbread and mix everything together. 05 of 11 Photo by  Charlene Jordan 03/28/2016 Made it for Easter and it was amazing. Some things I added/ substituted: a layer of sweet pickles and pickled jalapenos(with everything mixed they acquire a different delicious, delicious taste), a layer of pinto beans, greek yogurt instead of sour cream and light mayo. 06 of 11 Photo by  BaillysMom 06/10/2015 I used black beans instead of Pintos and I used a Spicy Ranch packet instead of regular. To accommodate a family member that's gluten intolerant, I made my cornbread with tapioca flour instead of regular flour. It made the cornbread crisp/brown and I liked that it kept it's texture. It didn't get soggy/mushy at all! It was a HUGE hit! Everyone had 2nd helpings! Some said they could eat this as a meal itself. I thought maybe the recipe made more than I needed but 8 of us DEVOURED the entire punch bowl full and this wasn't the only salad there! I posted a pic. :) It was super pretty, fresh and I will be making this again soon!!! Thank you for sharing it! 07 of 11 Photo by  Mallinda 07/16/2012 It sounds really strange, but this is a great salad. I've made it twice. The first time I followed the recipe exactly, and I thought the mayonnaise taste was too strong. The second time I reduced the mayonnaise to one cup and found that to be just fine. There was enough dressing, even with that reduction. I also took some other reviewers suggestion and just mixed everything together. I was taking it to a parish picnic and thought it would be easier that way. I would probably do that again in the future. Some reviewers said they thought it was better the second day, but I did not. I thought it was a little too moist, probably because the juice from the tomatoes was released. I highly recommend this for a different and tasty salad. 08 of 11 Photo by  Victoria Caylor 11/11/2010 09 of 11 Photo by  Victoria Caylor 11/11/2010 10 of 11 Photo by  Candice 11/05/2010 Cut recipe in half as I was using leftover cornbread. Since I am lactose intolerate , I omitted the sour cream and substituted it for 1.5 cups Ranch dressing. Omitted Cheddar cheese too! Very good. As suggested by other reviewers, I didn't layer; just threw together. I will most certainly make again. We loved it. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Mexican Cornbread Salad 160 Ratings Southwest Layered Salad 6 Ratings Cole's Cornbread Salad 120 Ratings Air Fryer Vegetarian Cauliflower and Chickpea Tacos 10 Ratings Southwest Chicken and Corn Bread Salad 1 Rating Three Bean Salad 313 Ratings Julie's Mexican Salad Inspiration 6 Ratings Summer Bean Salad II 32 Ratings Spruced-Up Slow Cooker Minestrone Soup 1 Rating Best Bean Salad 286 Ratings Southwestern Egg Rolls with Avocado Cilantro Sauce 18 Ratings Marinated Green Bean Salad 5 Ratings Salmon Tacos 23 Ratings Bean Salad 77 Ratings Quinoa Pilaf with Veggies and Chickpeas 1 Rating Spicy Mexican Minestrone Stew 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Rosemarie
instructions: Make the cornbread: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray the bottom and sides of an 8x8-inch pan with cooking spray.;Combine cornbread mix and water in a large mixing bowl until smooth; pour into prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Let cool; crumble and set aside.;Meanwhile, make the salad: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels.;Whisk sour cream, mayonnaise, and dressing mix together in a medium bowl.;Crumble 1/2 of the cornbread in the bottom of a large serving dish. Evenly layer with 1 can of pinto beans, 1/2 of the tomatoes, 1/2 cup green bell pepper, 1/2 cup green onions, 1 can of corn, 1 cup of cheese, 1/2 of the bacon, and 1/2 of the sour cream mixture. Repeat the layers. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours before serving. fabeveryday
